qas.question: How many components does the Belgian federalism have?
What are the Flemish representatives in favor for?

answers.text: Brussels resolution, with the exception of one party
the federal system passed in the parliaments of Wallonia and Brussels.

qas.question: How many components does the Belgian federalism not have?
What are the Flemish representatives not in favor of?

plausible_answers.text: the federal system passed in the parliaments of Wallonia and Brussels

context: On the other hand, Belgian federalism is federated with <a0_0><b4_0>three components<b4_0/><a0_0/>. An affirmative resolution concerning Brussels' place in <a3_0><b8_0>the federal system passed in the parliaments of Wallonia and Brussels<b8_0/>.<a3_0/> These resolutions passed against the desires of Dutch-speaking parties, who are generally in favour of a federal system with two components (i.e. the Dutch and French Communities of Belgium). However, the Flemish representatives in the Parliament of the Brussels Capital-Region voted in favour of <b7_0>the <a2_0>Brussels resolution<b7_0/>, with the exception of one party<a2_0/>. The chairman of the Walloon Parliament stated on July 17, 2008 that, "Brussels would take an attitude". <a1_0>Brussels' parliament<a1_0/> passed <b5_0><b6_0>the resolution<b6_0/><b5_0/> on July 18, 2008:
